com.berbils.game.Entities.ProjectileSpawners.ProjectileTypes

Class Projectiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.Entity
      • com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.CircleGameEntity
        • com.berbils.game.Entities.ProjectileSpawners.ProjectileTypes.Projectiles
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExplodingBulletCircle, SimpleBulletCircle

    public abstract class Projectiles
extends CircleGameEntity
    This class is the basis for all projectiles and any projectile must extend this, creates all necessary definitions and allows for easy spawning of multiple projectiles without creating many class object instances

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int damage
      The damage each projectile does on collision
      protected float maxRange
      The max distance in meters the projectile can travel before being destroyed, acting the same as if it had collided
      protected java.util.HashMap<com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Fixture,com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2> projectileInitialSpawnPoints
      A HashMap for keeping track of a projectiles initial spawn point so that if they travel outside of their max range they can be destroyed
      protected float projectileSpeed
      The speed at which the projectile travels in meters

      • Fields inherited from class com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.Entity

        catBits, entityBody, entityBodyDefinition, entityFixture, entityFixtureDefinition, entityShape, entitySprite, isStatic, maskBits, position, screen, sizeDims, spriteHandler, spriteLayer, userData, world

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Projectiles(float projectileSpeed, float projectileDiameter, int damage, float maxRange, java.lang.String textureFilePath, PlayScreen screen)
      This constructor instantiates required variables, creates a fixture and body definition but does not create any Box2D bodies, Box2d fixtures or sprites

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkMaxProjectileTravelDist()
      A method that iterates through the initial spawn point array, checking whether each fixture body has travevlled further than its max distance dictates, removing it if so
      abstract void collided(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Fixture projectile)
      All projectiles must have a collidede method

      Method for adding to the HashMap the fixture and a copy of its position
      void update(float deltaTime)
      Must be called when the world is updated and is there to check how far the projectile has travelled , removing it if it has travelled for further than its max range dictates

      • projectileSpeed

        protected float projectileSpeed
        The speed at which the projectile travels in meters

      • maxRange

        protected float maxRange
        The max distance in meters the projectile can travel before being destroyed, acting the same as if it had collided

      • damage

        protected int damage
        The damage each projectile does on collision

      • projectileInitialSpawnPoints

        protected java.util.HashMap<com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Fixture,com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2> projectileInitialSpawnPoints
        A HashMap for keeping track of a projectiles initial spawn point so that if they travel outside of their max range they can be destroyed

    • Constructor Detail

      • Projectiles

        public Projectiles(float projectileSpeed,
                   float projectileDiameter,
                   int damage,
                   float maxRange,
                   java.lang.String textureFilePath,
                   PlayScreen screen)
        This constructor instantiates required variables, creates a fixture and body definition but does not create any Box2D bodies, Box2d fixtures or sprites
        Parameters:
        projectileSpeed - The speed at which the projectile travels in meters
        projectileDiameter - The diameter of the projectile to be created in meters
        damage - The damage the projectile does
        maxRange - The maximum distance the projectile can travel before being destroyed by callings its collide method, in meters
        textureFilePath - The file path to the texture for the sprite, * NOTE - If this is null a sprite will * not be created
        screen - The screen the projectile will be spawned on

    • Method Detail

      • getDamage

        public int getDamage()
        Getter for the damage the projectile does
        Returns:
        the damage the projectile does

      • getProjectileSpeed

        public float getProjectileSpeed()
        Getter for the projectile speed of the objected
        Returns:
        the projectiles speed in meters

      • storeInitialSpawnPoints

        public void storeInitialSpawnPoints(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Fixture fixture)
        Method for adding to the HashMap the fixture and a copy of its position
        Parameters:
        fixture - The fixture of the projectile just created/spawned

      • deleteInitialSpawnPoint

        protected void deleteInitialSpawnPoint(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Fixture fixture)
        Method for removing a fixture and its associated spawn point from the hashmap
        Parameters:
        fixture - The fixture of the projectile just destroyed;

      • update

        public void update(float deltaTime)
        Must be called when the world is updated and is there to check how far the projectile has travelled , removing it if it has travelled for further than its max range dictates
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - The time in seconds that have elapsed in world time (Excludes time taken to draw, render etc) since the last Gdx delta call.

      • checkMaxProjectileTravelDist

        public void checkMaxProjectileTravelDist()
        A method that iterates through the initial spawn point array, checking whether each fixture body has travevlled further than its max distance dictates, removing it if so

      • getMaxRange

        public float getMaxRange()
        Getter for the max range of the projectile
        Returns:
        returns the max range of the projectile in meters

      • collided

        public abstract void collided(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Fixture projectile)
        All projectiles must have a collidede method
